alert.note: Alert for Barry (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 12:23PM EDT until April 11 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County. Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County. .Water from heavy rains earlier in the week continue to work through the rivers in West Michigan. The crest on the Grand River is expected to pass through the Grand Rapids area this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Thornapple River Above Hastings. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of River Road and homes at Quimby along River Lane, Charlton Park, and Berry`s Landing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EDT Friday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday afternoon and continue falling to 4.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 03/16/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
